ratings.comment:
Okay, let's be clear. Dr. Parrell (aka Dr. Par-Swell) is smokeshow. I googled him and apparently he is a world class frisbee football player!

Anyway, the class was hard but seeing him kept me coming. to class.
Engaging teacher. The class is hard but he gives you all the materials you need to succeed.

So many exams/midterms (5) and a cumulative final- however, they are all online/Honorlock. Besides that, Professor Parrell is a great teacher. Lectures are engaging, a little overwhelming, but very informative. Online labs and quizzes help prepare you for the exams. Exams are multiple choice, some short answer, and labeling diagrams.
Class was hard but he made it easy to learn. I found myself wanting to learn in this class. Only take if you are a CSD major

Fair and flexible class. Multiple exams, all online, so that each one covers less content. The class is straight memorization, but there are many optional resources to exceed. Work for each unit not due until the night before the exam. Study off of the study guides and learning objectives. Dr. Parrell is friendly, helpful, and responds quickly.

I've never had a professor I liked that insisted on being called Dr. Lastname, he's no exception. Clearly thinks highly of himself. I'm two semesters out from graduating, in 4 500 levels and this class, and this is simultaneously the most challenging and least educational class I'm in. He's also not funny. Six exams. Save yourself.

Parrell is a great person, but his lectures get very repetitive and eventually lead me to simply learn the material on my own. I found the class to be highly memorization based, which makes sense as it is an anatomy course. Overall, I'd say he did a fine job considering he isn't exclusively a professor.

Professor Parrell is amazing! He is very understanding and makes this class set up to be very manageable and fair. If you follow the work and attend lectures, you should succeed. Parrell makes himself and his TA very available and is very quick to respond to any questions. Would definitely recommend taking a class with him!

Professor Parrell is a great guy and does care about his students. The class is anatomy so there is a lot to know, but the lecture/slides have everything. There was 5 exams and a final, but they all seemed reasonable. I would not take this class if you aren't a CSD major.

This as an anatomy class, so there is a lot of information. 5 unit exams through the semester actually seemed to be less stressful, however the questions are extremely hard. The cumulative final seemed unfair as the sixth exam of the class with more than 1000 terms/structures to know.
Such a good professor but a very difficult class

I didn't have to take this course and I don't know why I took it anyways. Professor Parrell is a great guy so it's no fault of his that this class was so hard. There is SO much material. Even with studying, taking notes, paying attention in lectures, I was struggling to keep it all in my head.

His lectures are extremely dense and exams are 100% memorization. This course did not help me to actually learn and understand the material, and I found the course structure to be disengaging. He offers extra credit opportunities, however, they are very time-consuming and not worth many points, so it's not that helpful at the end fo the day.
Very difficult, requires a lot more studying than should be for a 3 credit class. Put more work into this class than my 5 cr bio152 class.

There's a lot to memorize, but that's the case with any anatomy class. Quizzes were open notes and you had two attempts. Exams were very similar to the quizzes and you could drop one exam. Other assignments were graded for completeness. He's a nice guy and makes the class as easy as possible.

This class can be challenging but Prof. Parrell is clearly interested in CSD. He posted the unit's lecture slides before the beginning of each unit, recorded his lectures, and even did trivia review days. I didn't find him confusing or a harsh grader, he is a very fair professor. I wouldn't recommend to take this class if you aren't a CSD major.

Prof Parrell is a funny guy who cares about his students. The class is anatomy, so it is very difficult. You definitely need to study every day. At first I didn't like how it was 5 exams and 1 final, but it makes sense overall because of all of the information. Makes it easier in the long run! I do not recommend taking if you're not a CSD major

Being in a class with Dr. Parrell is such a fun experience. He really cares about your understanding and stops to ask if the class understands frequently. He records all his lectures, so you don't need to go, but I highly recommend it. He's funny, thorough, and overall great. The class is anatomy, so its hard, but just study a little each day

Professor Parrell was a great professor! The class is made up of 5 tests and a final and there are quizzes throughout that are very similar to material on the test. Since this is an anatomy class, the material isn't easy and can be overwhelming but professor parrell is very willing to help you understand and is great at explaining.
Don't recommend if not a CSD major, there are a lot of terms to memorize... Parrell is very fair about grades and an A is achievable with a lot of time studying

Don't take this course unless you have to! A lot of information to memorize, most things have Latin names. I liked the professor, though. His activities during lectures are helpful. But still too much new terms to learn.

Took this class because someone told me it was an easy science class and they lied! This is a really hard class and you need to memorize a lot! I don't recommend taking this class unless you are required too. He is an unfair professor and does not care about the students. I spent weeks in the library studying and still didn't do well.

I took this class as a non CSD major, looking for an easy science gen ed... I was absolutely wrong. The content is pretty difficult and the 'quizzes' are quite hard. I somehow pulled off an AB but I worked my butt off in this class and put more time into it than I did for anything in my major

CSD 201 is not an easy class. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU ARE NOT A CSD MAJOR. Ben Parrell does not really care if you complain about your grades. You will have to study hard but it will be worth it if you actually care about the material and the major. An A is possible but it is not going to come without work. Also do not buy the textbook

I really enjoyed Professor Parrell. Although many people seemed to struggle with his class, it is an anatomy class so it's a little content heavy but nothing unbearable. He splits it into 6 "quizzes" which makes it easier to focus of specifics. He really tries to listen to feedback and changes what he can to make it easier on us. Would Recommend!

Dr. Parrell's lectures are very clear and well-organized. The tests are pretty much drawn from his slides, but the readings are helpful for studying. CSD201 was tough, but fair. There's a LOT of material to memorize, but it's very clear what you need to know. Study early, study a lot.

This class is really hard. The entire grade is 5 quizzes and 1 final. Professor is not reasonable, gives no curves, and doesn't teach well. You have to do a lot of studying outside of class and even after hours and days of studying, you still may not do well. He expects you to know everything and then only tests you on a few things.
